title: Property Strategy Summer Internship
requirements:
Description
The Property Strategy and Leasing team is responsible for developing the corporate real estate strategy for the bank, by evaluating the business and financial impacts of each option. This includes complex financial modeling, as well as close integration with our counterparts within the company to effectively evaluate their needs. The team is also responsible for conducting all interactions with landlords and tenants at our approximately 1,500 locations and payment of all rents, taxes, and utilities.

The Space Planning & Design team is responsible for managing the space allocations and seat assignments for all of our locations and employees, and for effectively designing and managing the creation of the interiors of our new locations. This team works closely with the rest of the property organization as well as each business unit within the bank to address their needs.

This internship will support both of these groups, and the responsibilities will include:

Assisting with financial modeling of various scenarios, including impacts to the P&L and Balance Sheet arising from cost variations and impacts to Net Book Value.
Due diligence on scenarios including examination of lease documents and proposals received from prospective landlords and tenants.
Survey of space use and design to determine if it is effectively serving the needs of the business. This will include data gathering and manipulation and analysis of that data and existing data.
Close integration with the corporate finance team
Assisting with the internal and external reporting and overhaul of that reporting

Qualifications
Qualifications:
Currently pursuing a Bachelor’s degree
All majors will be considered; Finance, Accounting, Economics or other analytical majors preferred
Expected graduation date of May 2021
Minimum GPA of 3.00 required
Must possess strong work ethic, attention to detail, and professionalism
Comfortable working in Microsoft Excel
Basic financial analysis skills (P&Ls, Balance Sheets)
Ability to follow up, and see a project or task through to completion
Intellectual CuriosityThe Property team will work with the candidate to explore areas of interest with them and provide them as much exposure as they would like to various other areas of the bank through job shadowing and other opportunities.
Why Work for Us
At Citizens, you'll find a customer-centric culture built around helping our customers and giving back to our local communities. When you join our team, you are part of a supportive and collaborative workforce, with access to training and tools to accelerate your potential and maximize your career growth.
Equal Employment Opportunity
It is the policy of Citizens Bank to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities to all colleagues and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, ethnicity, religion, gender, pregnancy/childbirth, age, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability or perceived disability, genetic information, citizenship, veteran or military status, marital or domestic partner status, or any other category protected by federal, state and/or local laws.
Equal Employment and Opportunity Employer/Disabled/Veteran
Citizens Bank is a brand name of Citizens Bank, N.A. and each of its respective subsidiaries

title: Property Strategy and Leasing Intern
requirements:
Description

The Property Strategy & Execution team is responsible for determining the proper strategy for each of our 1,100 branches, 130 office buildings and 300 remote ATMs and managing the non-facilities related aspects of these properties. This includes site selection, acquisition, and disposal, lease negotiations, sub-tenant interactions, and responding to items such as Estoppels, and SNDAs. We also manage all the leases for the company and manage the building of all new branches.

As an Intern on the team you will be an active participant in daily execution of team initiatives.

Primary responsibilities will include:

+ Filing leases and related documentation as required per records management policy

+ Assisting with further implementation of best practices for lease administration and portfolio strategy process. Including documenting procedures and developing risk control inventory where applicable

+ Assisting with the preparation of lease documents for execution

 Conducting site visits to existing locations and new sites under construction

+ Performing due diligence on scenarios including examination of lease documents and proposals received from prospective landlords and tenants

+ Participating in survey of space use and design to determine if it is effectively serving the needs of the business. This will include data gathering and manipulation and analysis of that data and existing data.

+ Assisting with the internal and external reporting and overhaul of that reporting

+ Assisting with various data collection tasks for the Branch Network Revitalization project

Qualifications

+ Must possess strong work ethic, attention to detail, and professionalism

+ Knowledge of Microsoft Excel and basic corporate finance (P&Ls, Balance Sheets)

+ Ability and willingness to perform a wide variety of tasks.

+ Ability to follow up, and see a project or task through to completion

+ Intellectual Curiosity

+ Ability to quickly learn new programs and software such as JLL OVLA and Lucernex

Education:

+ Currently pursuing a Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting or other related degree

+ Expected graduation date of May 2022

+ Minimum GPA 3.0

Hours and Work Schedule

Hours per Week: 40

Work Schedule: M-F 8:30am - 5pm

Why Work for Us

At Citizens, you'll find a customer-centric culture built around helping our customers and giving back to our local communities. When you join our team, you are part of a supportive and collaborative workforce, with access to training and tools to accelerate your potential and maximize your career growth.

Equal Employment Opportunity

It is the policy of Citizens to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities to all colleagues and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, ethnicity, religion, gender, pregnancy/childbirth, colleague or a dependent's reproductive health decision making, age, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability or perceived disability, genetic information, genetic characteristic, citizenship, veteran or military status, marital or domestic partner status, family status/parenthood, victim of domestic violence, or any other category protected by federal, state and/or local laws.

Equal Employment and Opportunity Employer/Disabled/Veteran

Citizens is a brand name of Citizens Bank, N.A. and each of its respective affiliates

title: Green Building Strategy Intern
requirements:
About us

Rensselaer Commercial Properties is a third-generation family-owned commercial real estate and land development firm based in Northern New Jersey. We own and manage commercial properties 25 miles from New York City where we lease office, recreational and flex-spaces, ideal for start-ups and small and mid-sized enterprises. Our properties also include self-storage facilities and rural land for rent or sale.

Green Building Strategy Intern

We are seeking an intern for a special project to develop and begin to implement a Green Building Strategy. You will work closely with the CEO throughout the internship, which can be conducted through a mix of on-site visits and remote work.

Role and Responsibilities
• Conduct benchmarking of all property assets using NJ Clean Energy framework
• Design approach for immediate implementation for new construction and phased approach to retrofit current property assets
• Develop project cost framework and model costs over time
• Prepare applications for NJ Clean Energy Programs appropriate for new construction and retrofits of existing assets
• Create (or adapt) a framework to track climate change impact data (KPIs)

Qualifications
• BA/BS in urban or environmental planning, business or other relevant field
• MA/MS/MBA course work a plus; current Master’s student preferred
• Previous experience in energy efficiency, green building technology and/or LEED building standards preferred
• Proficiency in Microsoft Office, G-suite and internet usage

About you
• You are proactive, well-organized, detail-oriented, and able to prioritize
• You have the highest levels of integrity, trustworthiness and discretion
• You possess excellent written and verbal communication skills
• You are able and eager to learn quickly, open to giving and receiving feedback

Application instructions
• Cover letter explaining your interest in the internship
• Current resume
• 3 References

Due date for applications: April 30, 2021, 5pm.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment opportunities are based upon one's qualifications and capabilities to perform the essential functions of a particular role. All employment opportunities are provided without regard to race, religion, sex, pregnancy, childbirth or related medical conditions, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law

title: Marketing and Social Media Intern
requirements:
An internship with Kayla Crugnale, Real Estate Advisor at Compass is categorized in the marketing department. I am looking for an intern to handle all marketing opportunities from print to digital to all social media accounts and will be headed by Kayla Crugnale. I am looking for an intern to take part in my monthly email newsletter, maintain and build my social presence amongst Instagram, Facebook, Linkedin and help with marketing efforts that are brand specific to build business as well as property specific to maximize exposure.

I am big on helping and developing team members from the bottom up. My interns would likely have a drive for marketing as well as Real Estate/Lifestyle. I have marketing goals and hope that an intern can help in achieving those.

The goal: To build business presence through digital and print campaigns to grow the book of buyers and sellers. To connect business with local brands and maintain a strong and influential presence amongst the community.

Intern responsibilities:
• Monthly Email Newsletter
• Website Management
• Blog Posts
• Manage Social Media accounts
• Paid sponsored ads
• Photoshoots
• Print Mailer Campaigns
• Brand collaborations + sponsorships
• Video Content
• Client Prospecting

An internship under Kayla Crugnale, Real Estate Advisor would be 80% remote, 20% in the field. In person mastermind meetings are still very important and photoshoots are necessary to produce content. All field requirements are local to the Boston area.

Looking for 10-15 hours a week for a period of 10 weeks at the moment. This could go on longer if all is successful. Through this internship you will become a representative of my brand so I want to be sure you are just excited about the business as I am

title: Internship Strategy Real Estate and Portfolio Management
requirements:

Amsterdam or Eindhoven - Depending on the possibility to work at the office due to the COVID-19 pandemic, for the time being you will mainly work from home and be supervised remotely.Type:

title: INTERN - People Strategy and Management Committee [Temporary]
requirements:
This internship shall be with the People Strategy and Management Committee located in the Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) New York. OCHA is the part of the United Nations Secretariat responsible for bringing together humanitarian actors to ensure a coherent response to emergencies. OCHA also ensures there is a framework within which each actor can contribute to the overall response efforts. OCHA's mission is to mobilize and coordinate effective and principled humanitarian action in partnership with national and international actors in order to alleviate human suffering in disasters and emergencies; advocate the rights of people in need; promote preparedness and prevention and facilitate sustainable solutions.

The People Strategy and Management Committee oversees people management across OCHA. The committee’s main objective will be developing and overseeing a four-year action plan for the OCHA People Strategy, including monitoring key performance indicators and proactively solving issues in human resources management. The committee will look to address these issues through a holistic approach, finding solutions through various lenses from across OCHA. The People Strategy and Management Committee is responsible for performing three key functions in OCHA: 1) Oversees the development and implementation of a four-year action plan for the OCHA People Strategy 2) Oversees the OCHA learning agenda, including the learning budget. 3) Acts as a discussion forum on issues relating to human resources management raised by staff and management.

The function can be performed remotely. The intern shall be under the general guidance and supervision of the Chief of the Learning Development Unit. The internship is being offered for a minimum period of three (3) months, with a possibility of extension up to six (6) months, starting as soon as possible.
Responsibilities

In general, the intern will support the People Strategy and Management Committee. Daily responsibilities will depend on the individual's background and may include but are not limited to assisting in the design and implementation of PSMC projects staff engagement, diversity and inclusion, talent management, duty of care and diversity and inclusion. Support the preparations for PSMC meetings including agenda and background documents. Coordinate follow up activities related to implementing the work of the PSMC. Contribute to the preparation of communication material, e. g. brochures, posters and newsletters. Respond to various inquiries and information requests internally and externally related to the work of the PSMC. Assist to track, monitor and report on the work of the PSMC through learning management systems and other data collection methods; and performing tasks as requested by supervisor, as appropriate.
Competencies

CLIENT ORIENTATION: considers all those to whom services are provided to be "clients " and seeks to see things from clients' point of view; establishes and maintains productive partnerships with clients by gaining their trust and respect; identifies clients' needs and matches them to appropriate solutions; monitors ongoing developments inside and outside the clients' environment to keep informed and anticipate problems; keeps clients informed of progress or setbacks in projects; meets timeline for delivery of products or services to client.

COMMUNICATION: speaks and writes clearly and effectively; listens to others, correctly interprets messages from others and responds appropriately; asks questions to clarify, and exhibits interest in having two-way communication; tailors language, tone, style and format to match the audience; demonstrates openness in sharing information and keeping people informed.

TEAMWORK: works collaboratively with colleagues to achieve organizational goals; solicits input by genuinely valuing others' ideas and expertise; is willing to learn from others; places team agenda before personal agenda; supports and acts in accordance with final group decision, even when such decisions may not entirely reflect own position; shares credit for team accomplishments and accepts joint responsibility for team shortcomings.
Education

To qualify for an internship with the UN Internship programme, applicants must meet one of the following requirements:

-Be enrolled in a graduate school programme (second university degree or equivalent, or higher); or -Be enrolled in the final academic year of a first university degree programme (minimum Bachelor's level or equivalent); or -Have graduated with a university degree

The University degree must be in the area of human resources, psychology, management, social sciences, international relations, management, public administration or in a related field.
Work Experience

No working experience is required to apply for the United Nations Internship Programme. Your training, education, advance course work or skills should benefit the United Nations during your internship.
Languages

English and French are the working languages of the UN Secretariat. For this internship fluency in English (both oral and written) is required. Knowledge of French is desirable. Knowledge of another UN official language is desirable .
AssessmentCandidates will be assessed based on their Personal History Profile (PHP). Individual interviews may be conducted by the Hiring Manager directly for further consideration. A complete online application (Cover note included in the PHP) is required. Incomplete applications will not be reviewed. The cover Note must include:
• Title of degree you are currently pursuing;
• Graduation date (when will you be graduating from the programme);
• IT skills and programmes in which you are proficient;
• Explanation why you are the best candidate for the internship position.

In your PHP, be sure to include all past work experience, if any; IT skills and three (3) references. Due to high volume of applications received, ONLY successful candidates will be contacted.
Special Notice

Applicants are encouraged to apply for internships which relate directly to their studies and/or skills and expertise. Applicants are asked to please indicate preferences which best match her/ his suitability and do so carefully in order to enhance the value of the internship for both the intern and the receiving United Nations (UN) Secretariat department/ office. For this position in particular, applicants should indicate in the cover letter their earliest availability (date/period) to start the Internship.

United Nations Considerations

According to article 101, paragraph 3, of the Charter of the United Nations, the paramount consideration in the employment of the staff is the necessity of securing the highest standards of efficiency, competence, and integrity. Candidates will not be considered for employment with the United Nations if they have committed violations of international human rights law, violations of international humanitarian law, sexual exploitation, sexual abuse, or sexual harassment, or if there are reasonable grounds to believe that they have been involved in the commission of any of these acts. The term “sexual exploitation” means any actual or attempted abuse of a position of vulnerability, differential power, or trust, for sexual purposes, including, but not limited to, profiting monetarily, socially or politically from the sexual exploitation of another. The term “sexual abuse” means the actual or threatened physical intrusion of a sexual nature, whether by force or under unequal or coercive conditions. The term “sexual harassment” means any unwelcome conduct of a sexual nature that might reasonably be expected or be perceived to cause offence or humiliation, when such conduct interferes with work, is made a condition of employment or creates an intimidating, hostile or offensive work environment, and when the gravity of the conduct warrants the termination of the perpetrator’s working relationship. Candidates who have committed crimes other than minor traffic offences may not be considered for employment.

Due regard will be paid to the importance of recruiting the staff on as wide a geographical basis as possible. The United Nations places no restrictions on the eligibility of men and women to participate in any capacity and under conditions of equality in its principal and subsidiary organs. The United Nations Secretariat is a non-smoking environment.

The paramount consideration in the appointment, transfer, or promotion of staff shall be the necessity of securing the highest standards of efficiency, competence, and integrity. By accepting an offer of appointment, United Nations staff members are subject to the authority of the Secretary-General and assignment by him or her to any activities or offices of the United Nations in accordance with staff regulation 1.2 (c). In this context, all internationally recruited staff members shall be required to move periodically to discharge new functions within or across duty stations under conditions established by the Secretary-General.

Applicants are urged to follow carefully all instructions available in the online recruitment platform, inspira. For more detailed guidance, applicants may refer to the Manual for the Applicant, which can be accessed by clicking on “Manuals” hyper-link on the upper right side of the inspira account-holder homepage.

The evaluation of applicants will be conducted on the basis of the information submitted in the application according to the evaluation criteria of the job opening and the applicable internal legislations of the United Nations including the Charter of the United Nations, resolutions of the General Assembly, the Staff Regulations and Rules, administrative issuances and guidelines. Applicants must provide complete and accurate information pertaining to their personal profile and qualifications according to the instructions provided in inspira to be considered for the current job opening. No amendment, addition, deletion, revision or modification shall be made to applications that have been submitted. Candidates under serious consideration for selection will be subject to reference checks to verify the information provided in the application.

Job openings advertised on the Careers Portal will be removed at 11:59 p.m. (New York time) on the deadline date.
No Fee

THE UNITED NATIONS DOES NOT CHARGE A FEE AT ANY STAGE OF THE RECRUITMENT PROCESS (APPLICATION, INTERVIEW MEETING, PROCESSING, OR TRAINING). THE UNITED NATIONS DOES NOT CONCERN ITSELF WITH INFORMATION ON APPLICANTS’ BANK ACCOUNTS

title: TAS - New York - Transaction Real Estate Hospitality Intern - Summer 2022
requirements:
The opportunity

Competitive business is driven by intelligent, informed decisions based on robust market research, data and strategic thinking. As a Strategy and Transactions (SaT) intern, you and your team will help clients in the real estate, hospitality, tourism and cruise sectors make strategic decisions that drive growth. You will be an important part of a diversely talented, multicultural and highly experienced Miami-based team that works at the forefront of high-profile real estate and hospitality developments, transactions and corporate investments in established and high-growth businesses. Our team of strategic professionals in Miami sits at the heart of both a 150-person US-based real estate Strategy and Transactions team and a global network of industry resources who deliver deep insights throughout the investment life cycle.

The Miami SaT team works on complex and high-profile global strategic initiatives, transactions and developments with a broad portfolio of clients generally in the real estate, hospitality, tourism and cruise sectors. We are a group of professionals with development, financing, brokerage and ownership backgrounds, which enables us to bring a wealth of deep sector and functional knowledge to our clients on a variety of projects, including initial feasibility studies, business plan assessments and market analyses, business and asset sustainability assessments, new industry/business growth opportunity studies and strategic divestitures. As a team, we prepare and execute business plans and identify ideas and sources of value enhancement, as well as assist on risk mitigation. Given today’s uncertain economic times as well as the impacts of rapidly advancing technology and shifting consumer preferences, the role of an independent strategic team has never been more important, and real estate developers, publicly traded companies, private equity and family offices are increasingly hiring our firm to assess the market and help them plan for the future.

Your key responsibilities
• Conduct market research for a variety of asset classes, including (but not limited to) hotels, mixed-use hotels and residential, marinas, vacation ownership, recreational real estate (i.e., golf courses, themed attractions), membership clubs, offices and other commercial properties
• Research and learn about strategic growth industries such as the cruise sector, the timeshare/vacation ownership sector, sustainable development/green development sector, and the health and wellness sector
• Support real estate, hospitality, and tourism advisory engagements with a focus on development, business plan assessment, valuation, acquisition, and divestiture
• Review and validate third-party and client-prepared real estate investment valuations for hospitality and/or commercial assets in the US, Latin America and the Caribbean
• Learn and assist with financial and cash flow modeling, property/portfolio modeling, business plan validation, data analysis, market research and due diligence, asset and business enterprise valuations, and valuation reviews

Your skills and attributes for success
• Business and commercially driven – work well in a fast-paced, exciting environment and have strong business acumen to drive value to our clients
• Learning - learn and develop technical and personal skills through a blend of structured learning, coaching, and experiences that are globally recognized (the EY experience)
• Building Relationships – cultivate strong working relationships with EY team members

Your qualifications
• Strong business writing skills
• Excellent analytical skills and the confidence to deduce meaningful insights from complex data
• Demonstrated aptitude for quantitative and qualitative analysis
• Ability to prioritize effectively and the skills to adapt quickly to new challenges and concepts
• Strong communication skills

Preferred qualifications
• Spanish and/or Portuguese fluency
• Experience or coursework in real estate

What we look for

We’re interested in students who demonstrate a passion for hospitality, real estate, and/or development in Latin America and the Caribbean who are eager to learn and able to thrive in fast-paced professional environments. If you have an entrepreneurial spirit and a passion for taking on new challenges, this role is for you.

What working at EY offers

If you join our firm full-time after your internship, we offer a competitive compensation package in which you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. In addition, our Total Rewards package includes medical and dental coverage, pension and 401(k) plans, a minimum of 18 days of paid time off plus 12 observed holidays and a range of programs and benefits designed to support your physical, financial and social well-being.

Plus, we offer:
• Support and coaching from some of the most engaging colleagues in the profession
• Opportunities to develop new skills and progress in your career
• Gained flexibility through two-way communication and commitment with your project teams

About EY

As a global leader in assurance, tax, consulting, strategy and transaction services, we hire and develop the most passionate people in their field to help build a better working world. This starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities and creative freedom to make things better. So that whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime.

Make your mark. Apply today

EY provides equal employment opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law.

By submitting your interest in this job, you agree to receive text notifications with additional steps to complete your job application. You will receive up to 6 messages from the number "63879". Message & data rates may apply. Please refer to our privacy policy for more information

title: Real Estate Debt Strategies Liquids 2022 Summer Analyst
Social Media Marketing/Copyrighting Internship (unpaid)
requirements:
As a growing brand management and strategy agency we are looking for an apprentice to assist with content management, creative copywriting, and social media.

Ideal candidate has creative writing skills, social media experience and a semi-understanding of how Pop-culture, Sports, Fashion and Entertainment intersects with branding, marketing, current events and general business news.

Working with Distaff will allow you access to amazing projects, an inspiring network, and the opportunity to grow your understanding of how to build, market, and grow a successful business or brand. This apprenticeship has the opportunity to turn into a full-time or extended contract position.

Weekly tasks would include:

Managing the development and delivery of company announcements, promotions, and release of information on an editorial timeline.

Assist with keeping information organized, coordinated and published on schedule.

Coordinate interviews with thought leaders, community leaders, clients and other featured VIPs.

Writing blog posts about related topics in business, culture, entertainment, branding, and media.

Research related quotes and content.

Converting blog posts, podcasts, and other content into social media posts.

Provide creative input and ideas on upcoming stories and editorial calendars as a whole.

Required graduation year

2013 - 2022

Requirements

Fluent in English and strong grasp of grammar

Exceptional writing and editing skills

Interest + Knowledge of U.S. pop-culture and entertainment

Ability to do a 3-6 month commitment

Has self-leadership skills and comfortable working virtually.

Ability to manage deadlines, research, develop and spark new ideas easily.

Must truly understand culture, creativity and the importance of quality aesthetics and powerful messaging in media.

Strong organizational and communication skills with meticulous attention to detail

Knowledge of MS Office and Google applications

Fact checking and some internet research a must

Personalized writing style (we want to hear your voice)

Wit and charming writing style (to draw your readers in)

Social media insight + some blogging experience.

Distaff focuses on Social Media, E-Commerce, and Fashion. Their company has offices in Boston. They have a small team that's between 1-10 employees.

You can view their website at https://www.distaff.app
